li.a: Virtual Learning Student Characteristics for Success
Stoughton Community Group Outdoor Facility Use
Annual Central Registration for Current Students

div.p: Â
Contact our district office: Please leave a message at (608)877-5012.Â Calls will be returned within 48 business hours.
Â

h5.strong: As of Thursday, April 16, SASD schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. At this time, we will continue our 4K-12 virtual learning. Please continue checking your email and referring back to this webpage for updates.

p.strong: Read our most recent communication to families.

li.a: Problem with Schoology? Here's what to do
Do's and don'ts - Safer at Home, social distancing, travel
"I'm feeling sick. What do I do?"

div.p: Stoughton Schools are closed but continue toÂ provide the opportunity for all of ourÂ children to receiveÂ free, nutritious meals.Â All children aged 18 and under, as well asÂ students aged 19-21 who have not yet graduated,Â regardless of free & reduced meal status,Â are eligible.

In an effort to serve our students and support the current stay at home order,Â we deliver meals door-to-door to those that have signed up.Â We alsoÂ provide meals for the weekend. This service will continue until school resumes.
Families currently using our meal pickup serviceÂ from our four locationsÂ will be automatically included in the door-to-door meal delivery effective April 17.
Families not signed up but who would like to,Â please fill out this form. Â Please note:Â

ul.li: A separate form for each child is needed to ensure each meal is included in our daily count.

Please know that depending on whenÂ you submit the form in our delivery cycle, the first delivery date of your meals may vary. Within 24 business hours of yourÂ submission, you will receive a confirmation phone call to review the delivery protocol and confirm the first delivery date of your meals.Â If you do not receive a call within 24 business hours, please contact Jenny McKenna atÂ jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.usÂ or leave a message at (608)877-5012.
4K and EC families: When filling out the form, please select the elementary school you are assigned to based on your address.
Deliveries will be made on Monday, Wednesday and Friday between 11 a.m. and 12 p.m.
Monday delivery will include: lunch for Monday;Â breakfast and lunch for Tuesday; and breakfast for Wednesday.
Wednesday delivery will include: lunch for Wednesday;Â breakfast and lunch for Thursday; and breakfast for Friday.
Friday delivery will include:Â lunch for Friday;Â breakfast and lunch for Saturday;Â breakfast and lunch for Sunday; and breakfast for Monday.

div.p: If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Jenny McKenna atÂ jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.usÂ or leave a message at (608)877-5012.

p.b: SASD schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. During school closure, the following conditions apply:

ul.li: Instruction will be virtual.
All district-sponsored events (concerts, performances, conferences, field trips, etc.) are cancelled.
All sports and other extracurricular practices and competitions are cancelled.
School buildings will be open to a select few of staff only.
All district facilities, including the pool, are closed for use by internal or external groups.

div.p: In the best interest of the health of our students and community, all out-of-state and abroad student trips are cancelled through the end of July, regardless of the school closure end date.

During this unprecedented health challenge, our SASD community remains committed to providing learning opportunities to all of our students. Since we became aware of the closure of our buildings, our instructional staff has been collaboratively innovating and designing virtual learning experiences for your child(ren). While our daily routines and instructional delivery will look very different from our usual pace, you will notice that our dedication, thoughtfulness, and concern for your studentâs growth remains steadfast.Â

While we are focused on your childâs academic, social, and emotional growth, we are also remaining mindful that this is also a time of intense pressure for our community, state, and world. So, it is our hope that you will see that our student learning plans are attentive to the uniquenesses of our families and students across our grade levels, allowing for flexibility and options for students who may need more support, especially in this new environment.

Our learning structure has some differences between students in grades K-5, and those in grades 6-12. Students in grades 6-12 will access Schoology, as they did on March 19-20. Please find information and plans related to your childâs virtual learning experience in the following places:

ul.li:
Elementary: At grades K-5, each school will have a website, with tabs for plans specific to each grade level. Check your childâs school website; then go to your childâs grade level:
Fox Prairie Site
Kegonsa Site
Sandhill Site

River Bluff Middle School & Stoughton High School: Students in grades 6-12 will continue to use Schoology to manage their learning (as they did from March 19-20). Students can find information about activities, assignments and any instructional content at each courseâs Schoology site.Â Students should continue to log in to the Schoology online learning platform each day.

div.p: As we move forward, we will be reaching out to families to learn more about your experiences with virtual learning, and how we can reflect and adjust to better meet needs.
As always, SASD is committed to serving our 4K and Early Childhood students and families,Â especially during this time.
4K:Â On Sunday, April 5, we launched our 4K virtual learning site. Click to view. We are so excited!
Early Childhood: We are providingÂ activities for Early Childhood families to implement "at home school." Find our suggested activities in ourÂ 4K/ECÂ newsletters.
April 21, 2020:Â In light of Governor Eversâ recent updates to the Safer at Home order, we will not be holding Summer Excel registration on Monday, April 27.

We are currently considering a variety of options for 2020 Summer Excel programming. Updates will be in family e-news and messaging when available.Â We will let you know ASAP when decisions have been made.
Thank you for your patience as work to determine the safest and best options for our students.

h2.a: Problem with Schoology? Here's what to do

div.p: Due to the increased demand of online applications from many districts, we are learning that service providers are experiencing issues on their end.Â At times, our learning management system, Schoology, has been intermittent at best. While this is largely out of the districtâs control, we wanted to provide guidance when learning applications experience issues now and in the future.

When there is an outage, the district will send out a communication to staff, familiesÂ and students. When services have been restored, the district will send a communicationÂ out to staff, familiesÂ and students.

p.strong: Guidance for students during an outage:

li.p: Check your email for directions or next steps from your teacher.
Know that you will not receive a lowered grade due to lateÂ submissions when learning applications are down.
Know that you will not be marked absent as a result of an outage.

div.p: Google Drive disconnects was one of the issues that has impacted some users.Â If you are experiencing issues with your Google Drive within Schoology, please view this tutorial on how to reconnect.

p.b: Timeline forÂ Schoology to be fixed during an outage

div.p: The unreliability of Schoology is not unique to Stoughton.Â All districts that have adopted Schoology as a learning management system are experiencing the same issues.Â Unfortunately, the district cannot address the issues we are experiencing and therefore cannot give a timeline of when it will be fixed. Â This is one reason why we have provided both students and staff guidance to reference in the event of an outage.

Technology Requests: By this time, most students should have received the necessary technology (hotspots and Chromebooks) to engage in virtual learning from home.Â If you still need to request technology, please contact your student'sÂ principal.Â (We are no longer using a Google Form.)
Technology Support Request via the internet:Â If your studentÂ experiences technology issues during their virtual learning, we are here to help.Â To submit a technology support request, click here.

Technology Support Request via phone:Â If you do not have access to the internet and are experiencing technology issues, you can call (608) 877-5056 toÂ leave a detailedÂ message describing the issue you are experiencing. A member of the technology team will followÂ up with you.

Chromebook Repairs:Â We will be open to exchange Chromebooks that are in need of repair by appointment only.Â After you complete the technology support form, you will be emailed instructions on how to make an appointment for repair.

Technology atÂ K-5 level: K-5 virtual learning will start after spring break, on Monday, March 30. Â ThisÂ start date allows both families and the district some time to continue working on technology assistance.Â At the K-5 level, virtual learning will likely be around 1-2 hours each day.Â However, not all of those 1-2 hours will be spent in front of a screen.

ul.li: Letter to families 3/27 from Keli Melcher, Director of Student Services

div.p: IEPs:Â The district will continue holding Annual IEPs during the closure as required by the Department of Education, the Office of Civil Rights, the Office of Special Education Programs, and the Department of Public Instruction. IEPsÂ will be held either through videoÂ conferenceÂ or phone conference during the school closure.Â When school resumes, we may hold review/revise meetings face-to-face as determined by IEP teams.

Evaluations:Â We will hold Evaluation meetings via video conferenceÂ or phone conferenceÂ if we have the information from testing that we need to make an eligibility decision.Â The teams will determine with you whether face-to-face evaluation is needed (delay the evaluation until school resumes) or whether testing can occur virtually (parental consent andÂ move forward with virtual meeting).

Service Delivery:Â Due to the Governor's order of school closure and no face-to-face instruction, we will continue to provide access to the general education curriculum and special education services to our students in a virtual format. These services may look very different than they do when school is in session. The district is currently working on a process. In the upcoming weeks, we will communicate with you either through your case manager, principal or more generally through the district's webpage.Â
THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR PATIENCE!Â STAY WELL!

Our district nurseÂ Laurel Gretebeck is committed to supporting our studentsÂ and families. After spring break, she will be holding daily office hours via phone and email, as well asÂ checking emails periodically during the school day.
Office hours: Weekdays fromÂ 9 to 11 a.m., starting Monday, March 30.
Contact information: Laurel.Gretebeck@Stoughton.K12.WI.US; (608) 352-9305
We are working on options for the best way to get medications to families.Â Please contact our district nurse Laurel Gretebeck ifÂ medications and health supplies are needed earlier.

ul.li: SAMHSA disaster distress hotline 1-800-985-5990 or text TalkWithUs to 66746 to connect with a trained crisis counselor.
National Suicide Prevention Lifeline:Â 1-800-273-8255
A Focus on Mental Health & Wellness (DPI)
CASEL CaresÂ for parents and caregivers
Talking to Children about COVID-19 (Parent Resource)

li.a: Recursos y links sobre el coronavirus (EspaÃ±ol y inglÃ©s)

div.p: El jueves, 16 de abril, La Secretaria del Departamento de Servicios de Salud de Wisconsin, Andrea Palm, bajo la direcciÃ³n del gobernador Evers, ordenÃ³ el cierre de todas las escuelas pÃºblicas y privadas de K-12 para el resto del aÃ±o escolar 2019-2020. Este anuncio tambiÃ©n extendiÃ³ el orden mÃ¡s amplia de MÃ¡s Seguro en el Hogar hasta el 26 de mayo.Â

En ese momento, continuaremos con el aprendizaje virtual con nuestros estudiantes 4K-12 para el resto del aÃ±o escolar. Por favor, presten atenciÃ³n a su correo electrÃ³nico para obtener actualizaciones y orientaciÃ³n sobre el aprendizaje virtual.
Durante el tiempo del cierre escolar (16 de marzo --), las siguientes condiciones aplican:

ul.li: Todos los eventos patrocinados por el distrito (conciertos, presentaciones, conferencias, excursiones, etc.) estÃ¡n cancelados.
Todos los deportes y otras prÃ¡cticas y competiciones extracurriculares estÃ¡n cancelados.
Los edificios escolares estarÃ¡n abiertos solo para algunos miembros del staff del distrito.
Todas las instalaciones del distrito, incluyendo la piscina, estÃ¡n cerradas para uso de grupos internos o externos.

div.p: Todos los eventos afuera de Wisconsin yÂ Estados UnidosÂ estÃ¡n cancelados del 3 de abril al 31Â de julio.

li.p: Grados 6-12: El aprendizaje virtual comienza el jueves, 19 de marzo.Â Busquen comunicaciones futuras del director de la escuela sobre el aprendizaje virtual.

ul.li: K-5: El aprendizaje virtual comienza despuÃ©s de las vacaciones de primavera el lunes, 30 de marzo. En los niveles de K-5, los maestros contactarÃ¡n a las familias si hay materiales especÃ­ficas de las clase para recoger durante las horas de recogida el martes/miÃ©rcoles. Busque comunicaciÃ³n futura del director de la escuela sobre el aprendizaje virtual.
Video conferencing opt-out (espaÃ±ol)
El Aprendizaje Virtual: Cuestionario familiarÂ (espaÃ±ol)

div.p: El 17 de abril

Junto con todos ustedes y nuestra comunidad SASD, tenemos muchas esperanzas de poder seguir con la programaciÃ³n para Summer Excel (clases del verano). Ahora mÃ¡s que nunca, nuestros estudiantes estarÃ¡n ansiosos por las oportunidades de conexiÃ³n, curiosidad y alegrÃ­a que ofrece Summer Excel. Gracias por su paciencia mientras esperamos cualquier informaciÃ³n que pueda ayudarnos a tomar nuestra decisiÃ³n. Si podemos ofrecer Summer Excel con seguridad, lo haremos.

En este momento, estamos programados para comenzar con registraciÃ³n el 27 de abril, que es dos semanas despuÃ©s de nuestra fecha de registraciÃ³n original del 13 de abril. Si recibimos informaciÃ³n que afecte esta decisiÃ³n, o la programaciÃ³n de Summer Excel de alguna manera, informaremos a todo el personal y las familias lo antes posible.

Lo major que podamos, proporcionaremos asistencia tecnolÃ³gica (punto de acceso al WiFi hotspots y Chromebooks) a las familias. Si su familia necesita una conexiÃ³n a internet, o si necesita una computadora âChromebookâ para sus hijos, por favor envÃ­e un correo electrÃ³nico a deena.ferguson@stoughton.k12.wi.us.

Las escuelas de Stoughton estÃ¡n cerradas pero van a proporcionar a las familias la oportunidad para registrarse para comidas nutritivas gratuitas para todosÂ los niÃ±os de 18 aÃ±os y menores y estudiantes de 19 a 21 aÃ±os que aÃºn no se han graduado.

Actualmente, el distrito ofrece la recogida de comida diaria en cuatro lugares a travÃ©s de un formulario de registro. En un esfuerzo por servir mejor a nuestros estudiantes y apoyar el orden Safer at Home (Orden de Emergencia MÃ¡s Seguro en el Hogar), nos cambiaremos a la entrega puerta a puerta comenzando el 17 de abril, 2020 y proporcionaremos comidas para el fin de semana hasta que se reanude la escuela.
div.h3: LaÂ entrega puerta a puerta, comenzando el 17 de abril, 2020
div.p: Las familias que ya recogen las comidas serÃ¡n trasladadas automÃ¡ticamente al nuevo proceso a partir del 17 de abril. El distrito llamarÃ¡ a las familias que ya estÃ¡n en nuestra lista de registraciÃ³n comenzando en la semana del 13 de abril para confirmar y repasar el nuevo proceso.

Para las familias no registradas pero quiÃ©n quisiera registrarse pueden hacer clic aquÃ­. Tenga en cuenta que necesita un FORMULARIO SEPARADO para cada niÃ±o para especificar que cada comida estÃ¡ incluida en nuestro cuento diario. RecibirÃ¡ una llamada telefÃ³nica de confirmaciÃ³n despuÃ©s de presentar el formulario para revisar el proceso de entrega. Si no recibe una llamada dentro de las 24 horas, comunÃ­quese con Jenny McKenna en jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.us.
div.h4: Proceso de entrega puerta a puertaÂ

li.p: Las entregas serÃ¡n los lunes, miÃ©rcoles, y viernes entre las 11 a.m. y las 12 p.m. Cada hogar recibirÃ¡ una llamada del distrito con un repaso del proceso.Â

ul.li: La entrega del lunes incluirÃ¡: el almuerzo para lunes, el desayuno y almuerzo para el martes, y el desayuno para el miÃ©rcoles.Â
La entrega del miÃ©rcoles incluirÃ¡: el almuerzo para el miÃ©rcoles, el desayuno y almuerzo para el jueves, y el desayuno para el viernes.
La entrega del viernes incluirÃ¡: el almuerzo para viernes, el desayuno y almuerzo para el sÃ¡bado, el desayuno y almuerzo para el domingo, y el desayuno para el lunes.Â

div.p: Para otras preguntas sobre la recogida de comidas: por favor, contacte a Jenny McKenna en (608)877-5012, o para ayuda en espaÃ±ol, Deena Ferguson en (608) 235-2847.
